channel.title: Search on Sujith Quintelier
channel.description: Recent content in Search on Sujith Quintelier

item.title: github: Improved search on the issues dashboard
item.description:
GitHub is rolling out semantic (natural-language) search in public preview on the Issues dashboard over the coming week.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure SQL updates for late-February 2026
item.description:
Late-February 2026 Azure SQL updates add a database object search feature to the MSSQL extension for Visual Studio Code.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: Improved search for GitHub Issues in public preview
item.description:
GitHub has launched an improved search for GitHub Issues, now in public preview. The new search leverages a semantic index to help you find the exact issue youâ€™re looking for more easily.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: vscode: Building docfind: Fast Client-Side Search with Rust and WebAssembly
item.description:
The article describes building docfind, a high-performance client-side search engine implemented in Rust and compiled to WebAssembly, and highlights how GitHub Copilot sped up development.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: github: Repository dashboard: Find, search, and save queries in preview
item.description:
GitHub announced a preview of a new Repository dashboard that helps users find repositories more easily by letting them search and save queries. The dashboard is intended to simplify navigating many projects and cross-team collaboration. (See: https://github.blog/changelog/2025-12-11-repository-dashboard-find-search-and-save-queries-in-preview)

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Support for Italian and Portuguese in Azure Cosmos DB for NoSQL full-text search
item.description:
Azure Cosmos DB for NoSQL now supports Italian and Portuguese in its full-text search capability. The feature is available today in public preview and lets you build richer, language-aware search experiences.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: enterprise: qualifier is now generally available in GitHub code search
item.description:
GitHub code search now includes a new enterprise: qualifier (generally available) that lets you search across all organizations in your enterprise, simplifying searches that previously required manually combining multiple organizations.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Improved file navigation and editing in the web UI
item.description:
GitHub announced improvements to the web UI to make file navigation and editing faster and simpler. A highlighted change is seamless editing from search results so that search hits link directly to files with the ability to open and edit them in the web editor.

  • Source: GitHub
